subtraho: <entryFree id="n46172" type="main" key="subtra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw away from underneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by stealth;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to draw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc. (class.; syn. subduco). </sense><sense id="n46172.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtractus Numida mortuo superincubanti Romano vivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 9</bibl></cit> (Weissenb. substratus): <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus raptim tellus subtracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effracto colla jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro (peculium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(impedimenta) clandestinā fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem cuniculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dediticii subtrahantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastatos primae legionis ex acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ab dextro cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 37</bibl></cit>: cibum alicui, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam, quae laedere videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn away</tr>, <tr>avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a curiā et ab omni parte rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>, <tr>retire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUBU" /> teque adspectu ne subtrahe nostro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 465</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam ad Parthos se subtrahentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:43" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus domino se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl></cit>. — Also without <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente interdiu vel noctu subtrahebat,</quote> <trans><tr>he would withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum praetorio non ex ingerentibus sed ex subtrahentibus legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 86, 2</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: vastis tremit ictibus puppis Subtrahiturque solum,</quote> <trans><tr>withdraws itself</tr>, <tr>gives way under it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtracto solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtractus fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46172.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verba sedem habere possunt, si rem subtraxeris, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria cum periculo subtrahuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba pudoris gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">S litteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliis nominatis, me unum subtrahebat,</quote> <trans><tr>to omit</tr>, <tr>not mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">9: aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui judicio eum mors subtraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem irae militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem minis populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Reflex.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me a curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se legum actionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se discrimini alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Ruhnk. et saep.: subtrahente se, <hi rend="ital">withdrawing himself</hi> (as surety), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtremulus: <entryFree id="n46173" type="main" key="subtre^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat tremulous</hi>, Ps.-Soran. 280.</sense></entryFree>
subtriplus: <entryFree id="n46174" type="main" key="subtriplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-triplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contained three times in</hi> a larger number, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtristis: <entryFree id="n46175" type="main" key="subtristis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tristis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subtristis visus est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera subtristior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtritus: <entryFree id="n46176" type="main" key="subtri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subtero.</entryFree>
subtunicalis: <entryFree id="n46177" type="main" key="subtu^ni^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtŭnĭcālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-tunica</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(podu/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n46177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the under-garment of a Jewish priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subturpiculus: <entryFree id="n46178" type="hapax" key="subturpi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-turpĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat mean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subturpis: <entryFree id="n46179" type="hapax" key="subturpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-turpis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat mean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint, quod ridiculi proprium est, subturpia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 264</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtus: <entryFree id="n46180" type="main" key="subtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from sub; like intus, from in</etym>, <sense id="n46180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi> (mostly ante-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): subtus ambulare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra subtus pendula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani aggere et vineis et omnibus supra terram operibus, subtus Macedones cuniculis oppugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
subtussio: <entryFree id="n46181" type="hapax" key="subtussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tussĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cough slightly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 25</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
subtusus: <entryFree id="n46182" type="main" key="subtu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tundo], <sense id="n46182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bruised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flet teneras subtusa genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 55</bibl></cit>: angulus, <hi rend="ital">an obtuse angle</hi>, Boëth. Geom. 1, p. 1180.</sense></entryFree>
subtutus: <entryFree id="n46183" type="main" key="subtu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderately safe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instr. 30, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subucula: <entryFree id="n46184" type="main" key="su^bu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub - UO; whence exuo</etym>. <sense id="n46184.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s under-garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shirt</hi>: postea quam binas tunicas habere coeperunt, instituerunt vocare subuculam et indusium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the priest's dress,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 8, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46184.1" n="II" level="1"> Subuculam Aelius Stilo et Cloatius iisdem fere verbis demonstrant vocari, quod dis detur ex alicā et oleo et melle. Nam de tunicae genere notum est omnibus, Fest. pp. 308 and 309 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
subula: <entryFree id="n46185" type="main" key="su_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n46185.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an awl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforabit aurem ejus subulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 15, 17</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46185.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a very small weapon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subulā armatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: subulā leonem excipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 82:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subulcus: <entryFree id="n46186" type="main" key="su^bulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbulcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from sus; formed in analogy with bubulcus</etym>, <sense id="n46186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swine-herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl> and 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 19</bibl> Wagn. (al. bubulci).</sense></entryFree>
subulo: <entryFree id="n46187" type="main" key="su_bu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n46187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flute-player</hi>, the Tuscan name for tibicen: <cit><quote lang="la">subulo Tusce tibicen dicitur. Itaque Ennius: Subulo quondam marinas propter astabat plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 35</bibl> ib. (Sat. v. 41 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n46187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of hart</hi> <cb n="SUBV" /> <hi rend="ital">with pointed horns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:231" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 231</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46187.2" n="III" level="1"> Perh. i. q. paedico, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46188" type="main" key="Su_bu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūbŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. subulo</etym>, <sense id="n46188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g. P. Decius Subulo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subumbilicus: <entryFree id="n46189" type="main" key="su^bumbi^li_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-umbĭlīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the parts below the navel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Zach. 1</bibl> ad 2, 18.</sense></entryFree>
subumidus: <entryFree id="n46190" type="hapax" key="su^bu_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ūmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat moist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subunctio: <entryFree id="n46191" type="main" key="su^buncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-unctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:22" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subur: <entryFree id="n46192" type="main" key="Su^bur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbur</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Rubricatus</hi>, perh. the mod. Villa Nuova, in Castile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Subur</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 414, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subura: <entryFree id="n46193" type="main" key="Su^bu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (abbrev. SVG.; <sense id="n46193.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quarter in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the second region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Esquiline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Viminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Quirinal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where provisions were sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and where many prostitutes dwelt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura Junius scribit ab eo, quod fuerit sub antiquā Urbe: quoi testimonium potest esse, quod subest ei loco, qui Terreus murus vocatur. Sed ego a pago potius Succusano dictam puto Succusam, quod in notā etiam nunc scribitur tertia littera C, non B,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 48</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura cum tribus litteris notatur, C litteram ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:66:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 66, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:12" default="NO">7, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:94:5" default="NO">10, 94, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:32" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 141</bibl> (v. Subura, Becker, Antiq. vol. 1, p. 521 sq.; and cf. id. Gall. vol. 3, p. 44, 2d ed.). — Hence, </sense><sense id="n46193.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Subura</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suburan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § 56 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Esquiline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:22:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:58" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a prostitute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:78:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 78, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 61, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46193.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrānenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers in the Subura</hi>, Fest. s. v. October, p. 178 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
suburbanitas: <entryFree id="n46194" type="main" key="su^burba_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suburbanus</etym>, <sense id="n46194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearness to the city of Rome</hi>: suburbanitas hujusce provinciae (Siciliae), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:22" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
suburbanus: <entryFree id="n46195" type="main" key="su^burba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated near the city of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suburban.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46195.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus suburbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:61" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 43</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n46195.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46195.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbā-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. praedium), <hi rend="ital">an estate near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suburban villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo esse in Tusculano aut uspiam in suburbano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13:6:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbana amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 13</bibl>, b, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:35:3 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 35, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46195.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the towns near Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suburbicarius: <entryFree id="n46196" type="main" key="su^burbi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urbĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, late jurid. Lat. for suburbanus, <sense id="n46196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suburban</hi>: regiones, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 9; 11, 28, 12; 11, 16, 12: mare, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suburbium: <entryFree id="n46197" type="hapax" key="suburbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-urbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>urbs</etym>, <sense id="n46197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suburb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suburbium ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suburgeo: <entryFree id="n46198" type="hapax" key="su^burge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urgĕo</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbur-guĕo</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urge close to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proram ad saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suburitani: <entryFree id="n46199" type="main" key="Su^bu_ri^ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrĭtāni</orth>, v. Subur.</entryFree>
suburo: <entryFree id="n46200" type="main" key="su^bu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ūro</orth>, no <sense id="n46200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ustum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to burn slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to singe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura nuce ardenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subustum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 7, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subustio: <entryFree id="n46201" type="hapax" key="su^busti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbustĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suburo</etym>, <sense id="n46201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heating from below</hi>: thermarum, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 32.</sense></entryFree>
subustus: <entryFree id="n46202" type="main" key="su^bustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from suburo.</entryFree>
subvades: <entryFree id="n46203" type="gloss" key="subva^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-vas</etym>, <sense id="n46203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sub-sureties</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">those who give surety for the bail</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvectio: <entryFree id="n46204" type="main" key="subvecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae subvectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvecto: <entryFree id="n46205" type="main" key="subvecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> from below (on the shoulder, <pb n="1786" /> <cb n="SUBV" /> by ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi> to a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">asini, qui tibi subvectabant rure huc virgas ulmeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">panaria candidasque mappas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora cymbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, quae frumentum Tiberi subvectassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvector: <entryFree id="n46206" type="hapax" key="subvector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bosporus Inachiae subvector virginis olim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvectus: <entryFree id="n46207" type="main" key="subvectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subveho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46208" type="main" key="subvectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subveho: <entryFree id="n46209" type="main" key="subve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕho</orth>, <itype>vexi, vectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> from below (on the shoulder, by ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> to a place, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry up stream</hi>, etc. (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ast alium (aërem fluere) subter, contra qui subvehat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 515</bibl></cit>: frumentum flumine Arari navibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum remis superes subvectus ut amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvecta ponto Barbara agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris fratrisque cineres Romam Tiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utensilia ad Ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicus Nilo subvehebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus lembis biremibus flumine adverso subvectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 43, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae, per quas commeatus ex Samnio subvehebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Palladis arces Subvehitur magnā matrum regina catervā,</quote> <trans><tr>is borne aloft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvecta per aëra curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 796</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvello: <entryFree id="n46210" type="main" key="subvello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vello</orth>, no <sense id="n46210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, vulsum (volsum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull out</hi> (only in the two foll. passages): rador, subvellor, desquamor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 15</bibl>: qui barba volsa feminibusque subvolsis ambulet, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvelo: <entryFree id="n46211" type="main" key="subve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overshadow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Lib. Arb. 2:38" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Lib. Arb. 2, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvenio: <entryFree id="n46212" type="main" key="subve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (old <sense id="n46212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> subvenibo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 20</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advance to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistance</hi> (the figure taken from the advance of a military reserve; v. subsidium), <hi rend="ital">to come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor; to obviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi> a disease, an evil, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: adjuvo, succurro, sublevo). </sense><sense id="n46212.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (equitibus) celeriter subveniunt levis armaturae pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucanius circumvento filio subvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varenus illi laboranti subvenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo quaeso, subveni mihi atque adjuva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subveni patriae, opitulare collegae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvenire et opitulari patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvenisti homini jam perdito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci subveniendum Adherbali censebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri auxilii est, judices, hujus innocentiae subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti suae acrioribus remediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilitati dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 74</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravedini omni ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 61, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:112" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 37, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic meae sollicitudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tam periculosis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of the prætor, <hi rend="ital">to render official</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicial aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequissimum erit praetorem ei subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subveniri generi humano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">D. Bruti operā, etc. ... provinciae Galliae esse subventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic quoque rei subventum est maxime a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi celeriter sociis foret subventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et defendam et subvenibo sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, fi benignus, subveni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvenior, judices, nisi subvenitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:260" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum orare, ut subveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et subventuros auferet unda deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ex castris subveniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni subveniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi in tempore subventum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46212.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aliud in eo (sale) mirabile est, quod tantundem nocte <cb n="SUBV" /> subvenit, quantum die auferas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46212.6" n="1" level="3"> Ut quaeque vox digna animadverti subvenerat, memoriae mandabamus, <hi rend="ital">came to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurred to us</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> to him; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subventio: <entryFree id="n46213" type="main" key="subventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subvenio</etym>, <sense id="n46213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rendering aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvento: <entryFree id="n46214" type="hapax" key="subvento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n46214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to come with assistance</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">spes bona, opsecro, subventa mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subventor: <entryFree id="n46215" type="gloss" key="subventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who comes in aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CIVIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">POPVLI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3766</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subventralis: <entryFree id="n46216" type="main" key="subventra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-venter</etym>, <sense id="n46216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subventral</hi>, med. t. t., Ps. - Soran. Quaest. Med. 235.</sense></entryFree>
subventrile: <entryFree id="n46217" type="main" key="subventri_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ventrīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abdomen</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">u(pokoi/lion,</foreign> sumen, subventrile, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
subverbustus: <entryFree id="n46218" type="main" key="subverbustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subverbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perhaps contr. from sub verubus ustus</etym>, <sense id="n46218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">branded under the spear</hi>, an epithet of a male or female slave (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subverbustam veribus ustam significat Plautus cum ait: ulcerosam, compeditam, subverbustam, sordidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subvereor: <entryFree id="n46219" type="main" key="subve^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <sense id="n46219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat fearful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apprehensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvereri ne te delectet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subversio: <entryFree id="n46220" type="main" key="subversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subverto</etym>, <sense id="n46220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subverso: <entryFree id="n46221" type="hapax" key="subverso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subverso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorso</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subversor: <entryFree id="n46222" type="main" key="subversor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overturner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subverter</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">legum (opp. auctor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae (diabolus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subversus: <entryFree id="n46223" type="main" key="subversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subverto.</entryFree>
subverto: <entryFree id="n46224" type="main" key="subverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn upside down; to upset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n46224.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinum aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas operum moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:645" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversi montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arisbe terrarum motu subversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvani simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obices portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceus olim Si pede major erit, subvertet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46224.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversa jacebat Pristina majestas soliorum,</quote> <trans><tr>overthrown</tr>, <tr>subverted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversa Crassorum et Orphiti domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes privignos per occultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to ruin</tr>, <tr>undo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia fidem, probitatem ceterasque artes bonas subvertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges ac libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48, 10</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea quae majores pepererunt, subvortunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptam legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praejudicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretationem adversarii (opp. confirmare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem orandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquiora beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis domus delatorum interpretationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitum imperium brevis momenti culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvespertinus: <entryFree id="n46225" type="hapax" key="subvesperti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vespertīnus</orth> <itype>ventus</itype>, <sense id="n46225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southwest wind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvesperus: <entryFree id="n46226" type="hapax" key="subvespe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vespĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ventus), <sense id="n46226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southwest-by-west wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvestio: <entryFree id="n46227" type="main" key="subvesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe from beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe by degrees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nova subvestit reparatas pluma volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> 1, 642</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvexus: <entryFree id="n46228" type="hapax" key="subvexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloping upwards</hi> (opp. devexus): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fastigio leni subvexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvilicus: <entryFree id="n46229" type="gloss" key="subvi_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vīlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-steward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">HORTORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2860</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subviridis: <entryFree id="n46230" type="main" key="subvi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 65, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balanitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 201" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 201</bibl></cit> and 202.</sense></entryFree>
subvolo: <entryFree id="n46231" type="main" key="subvo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi> (rare but class.): hae (partes corporum)<cb n="SUCC" />  sursum in caelestem locum subvo lent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:507" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:577" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 577</bibl></cit>: ad capita, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvolsus: <entryFree id="n46232" type="main" key="subvolsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvolsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">subvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subvello.</entryFree>
subvolvo: <entryFree id="n46233" type="hapax" key="subvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-volvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 424</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvulturius: <entryFree id="n46234" type="hapax" key="subvultu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vultŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat vulture-like</hi>, a facetiously formed word: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sucasini: <entryFree id="n46235" type="main" key="Sucasi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucasīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Succas-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the Interamnates on the Liris in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succabar: <entryFree id="n46236" type="main" key="Succabar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succabar</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succaelestis: <entryFree id="n46237" type="main" key="succaelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-caelestis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is under the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subcelestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublunary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebdomas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succaeruleus: <entryFree id="n46238" type="hapax" key="succaeru^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-caerŭlĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succandidus: <entryFree id="n46239" type="main" key="succandi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-candĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 39, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 94, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succasini: <entryFree id="n46240" type="main" key="Succasi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succasīni</orth>, v. Sucasini.</entryFree>
succasses: <entryFree id="n46241" type="main" key="Succasses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succasses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succavus: <entryFree id="n46242" type="main" key="succa^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-căvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollow below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">areae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 557</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Limit. pp. 252, 260, 303 Goes.: natura Aetnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 682</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succedaneus: <entryFree id="n46243" type="main" key="succe_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succēdānĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdāneus</orth> (on the latter very ancient orthog. cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 4 sq.</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>succedo</etym>, <sense id="n46243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succeeds to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">that supplies the place of</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succedaneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia, quae ad aras adducta est immolanda, si casu effugeret, effugia vocari veteri more solet: in cujus locum quae supposita fuerat, succidanea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl></cit>; cf. Gell. l. l.; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.: si quid succidaneis opus esset, robus succederet, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus pro homine succidaneus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meum tergum stultitiae tuae subdas succidaneum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subrogare aliquem succedaneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avum suum Pharnacem succedaneum regi Pergameno Eumeni datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">succēdānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representative;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">functionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succedo: <entryFree id="n46244" type="main" key="succe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sub]. </sense><sense id="n46244.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. subeo). </sense><sense id="n46244.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac primum nubes succedere soli Coepere,</quote> <trans><tr>to go under the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 286</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum, cui imbris vitandi causā succederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestae Succedunt ramis volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:505" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedere tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 766</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:549" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 549</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 627</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex jussae succedit aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecto et umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 6</bibl></cit> and 19: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo sineret succedere terrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens imo Successit tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go from under; to go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>to mount</tr>, <tr>ascend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc itinere est fons, quo mare succedit longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:597" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28</bibl></cit> et saep. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigi scalas jussit ac promptissimum quemque succedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montem succedere silvas Cogebant,</quote> <trans><tr>to retreat to the mountains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1370</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sententiae verbaque omnia ... sub acumen stili subeant et succedant necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externae dominationi, quam in suis timuerunt, sponte succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedoque oneri,</quote> <trans><tr>take up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec qui succederet operi inventus est,</quote> <trans><tr>undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pedibusque minutatim succedere frigus Non dubitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ad superos Succedet famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in summum successit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1275</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw near</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n46244.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to march on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (class. and freq.; cf.: invado, progredior): <pb n="1787" /> <cb n="SUCC" /> sub primam nostram aciem successerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: supra hostium munitionem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra hostium infestis signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad stationes hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostium latebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsum vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portūs claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter ad molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionibus, Auct. B. Alex. 30, 4: portas succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis paulatim successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque iniquo successum est loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come into the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed; to succeed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive by succession</hi> (syn. subsequor). </sense><sense id="n46244.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut integri et recentes defatigatis succederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in paternas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Pompeii locum heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sequani principatum dimiserant. In eorum locum Remi successerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
