G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego in ejus quem occidissem succederem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedam ego vicarius tuo muneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 70, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post ejus mortem frater regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujus locum filia regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: in regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic Mithridates filius succedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alteram partem succedunt Ubii,</quote> <trans><tr>follow</tr>, <tr>come next</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit in teretes lignum succedere suras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 80</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum, quod tibi succederetur, sed quod Gabinio non succederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te antea, quam tibi successum esset, decessurum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46244.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enter into</hi> a relation: <cit><quote lang="la">in affinitatis jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46244.15" n="(a)" level="5"> In time: <cit><quote lang="la">successit ipse magnis (oratoribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum aetati successit Isocrates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil semper floret: aetas succedit aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia post illas successit aënea proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum priores duae probationi succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā violis succedit rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl></cit>: etenim ei succedo orationi, quae, etc., <hi rend="ital">I succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I speak after an oration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules, quo majori gloriae rerum gestarum succedere se cernebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ... succedens tantae caritati Hieronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bono succedenti regi difficilis aemulatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 48, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46244.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> in value: cujus (purpurae) libra denariis centum venibat ... huic successit dibapha Tyria, quae in libras denariis mille non poterat emi, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vicem ejus (graminis) succedit decoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non numero tantum amissorum civium, sed et dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii magnitudini patris successerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male gestis rebus alterius successum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.17" n="c" level="4"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> the nature or rule of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to belong to</hi> a class or category (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">succedere hanc quoque comparativo generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnia succedunt legitimis quaestionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.18" n="d" level="4"> Pregn.: res (alicui) succedit, or simply succedit, <hi rend="ital">goes on well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prospers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeds</hi> (cf. evenit): <cit><quote lang="la">lepide hoc succedit sub manus negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium (ei) sub manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando hoc bene successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum succedit, quod ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque non succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod res nulla successerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum non succedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil conceptae temere spei succedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti Phoebus succedere partem Mente dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prospere prima successerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac non successit: aliā ingrediemur viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando minus succedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex sententiā successerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: si proinde, ut ipse mereor, mihi successerit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si successisset coeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUCC" /> 25: <cit><quote lang="la">facinori eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">successurumque Minervae Indoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 788</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: cum omnia meā causā velles mihi successa, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolle successum non patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque iniquo successum erat loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 13</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
succendo: <entryFree id="n46245" type="main" key="succendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-candeo; v. accendo</etym>, <sense id="n46245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set on fire from below</hi> (syn. inflammo). </sense><sense id="n46245.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(sapiens) etiamsi in Phalaridis tauro inclusus succensis ignibus torreatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem cuniculo hostes succenderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cumulata in ingentem acervum ipse imperator face subditā succendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus duabus manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem suis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër fulminibus succenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 790" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 790</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46245.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rubor igneus ora Succendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura infecit niveos vultus per liquidas succensa genas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46245.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi> with passion, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">succenseo): succendit Castora Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deucalion Pyrrhae succensus amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera succensa cupidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā succensa senectā (i. e. amore patris senis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 18), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">(furorem) succendunt classica cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 166</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in bella succensi mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 779" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succensas agit libido mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 541" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succensi irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctu succensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:585" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcedine famae succensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens facibus pudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 221</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succeno: <entryFree id="n46246" type="hapax" key="succe_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-, succoe-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dine underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba de piscibus, qui cum pridie ex parte adesi et versati postero die appositi essent, Festinemus, alii subscenant, inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 90</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succenseo: <entryFree id="n46247" type="main" key="succense^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĕo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suscensĕo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>succensus, from succendo</etym>, <sense id="n46247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be inflamed with anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi> (class.; syn.: irascor, indignor). </sense><sense id="n46247.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus irasci et succensere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi sum iratus neque quicquam succenseo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tibi suscensui, Quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil succenseo Nec tibi nec huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu illi succenseas, ne tibi illum succensere aliquid suspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero iis ... habeo quod suscenseam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Atheniensibus succensuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis mihi jure succenseat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse aut ipsi aut militibus succensendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46247.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fecit quod succenseas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si sic sua habituram dicat, quis tandem succenseat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud succensendi tempus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar succensens propter curam verrendis viis non adhibitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 17.— * </sense><sense id="n46247.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata hominum non succensenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succensio: <entryFree id="n46248" type="main" key="succensi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succendo</etym>, <sense id="n46248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lavacri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a heating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prunarum nimia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina succensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46249" type="hapax" key="succensi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succenseo</etym>, <sense id="n46249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam succensionis obliterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:35" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succensus: <entryFree id="n46250" type="main" key="succensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n46250.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> from succendo.—</sense><sense id="n46250.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> from succenseo.</sense></entryFree>
succentivus: <entryFree id="n46251" type="main" key="succenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>succino</etym>, <sense id="n46251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succentor: <entryFree id="n46252" type="main" key="succentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accompanier</hi> in singing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 87:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 12, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46252.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a furtherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succenturio: <entryFree id="n46253" type="main" key="succentu^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-centŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), no <sense id="n46253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to receive as a recruit into a</hi> centuria; hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to put in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">receive as a substitute</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">succenturiare est explendae centuriae gratiā supplere, subicere, Plaut. ap. Saturione: succenturia, centum require, qui te delectent domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cb n="SUCC" /> nunc prior adito tu, ego in insidiis hic ere Succenturiatus, si quid deficies, <hi rend="ital">as a reserve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 55</bibl>; cf.: tota metaphora de re militari est. Succenturiati dicuntur, qui explendae centuriae gratiā subiciunt se ad supplementum ordinum, Don. ad. h. l.: et alia esca melior atque amplior succenturietur, Favor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46254" type="main" key="succentu^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-centŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-officer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-centurion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succentus: <entryFree id="n46255" type="hapax" key="succentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succino</etym>, <sense id="n46255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accompanying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompaniment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succerno: <entryFree id="n46256" type="main" key="succerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cerno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sift.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46256.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaceos cottidie recentes succernito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 7</bibl>; 151, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">iste gradus succretu'st cribro pollinario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46256.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shake up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, Sev. Aetna, 492.</sense></entryFree>
successio: <entryFree id="n46257" type="main" key="successi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succedo, II.</etym>. <sense id="n46257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A coming into the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">a following after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succession</hi> in office, possession, etc. (mostly post-Aug.): si merces Antonii oppressi poscitur in Antonii locum successio, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronis principis successio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum non dubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spem successionis admoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus judicia per annuas successiones permisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae, quae per successiones jus sibi vindicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi per successiones quasdam traduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura successionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris amotio successionem afficit voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A good issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">successio prospera consecuta est, Aug. (perh. Cic. Hort. Fragm.) Vit. Beat. 26: victoriam proeliorum successionibus relaturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
successivus: <entryFree id="n46258" type="spur" key="successi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successīvus</orth>, a false read. for succissiva, Lact. Opif. Dei, 12, 15 Bünem. ad loc.</entryFree>
successor: <entryFree id="n46259" type="main" key="successor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succedo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n46259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successor</hi> in office, possession, time, etc. (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vicarius): conjunctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">successori decessor invidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. Fragm. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorem alicui mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove from office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legato eum consulari successorem dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorem accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successores Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studii successor et heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo successore (Philoctete) sagittae Herculis utuntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the succeeding possessor</tr>, <tr>inheritor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni criminis successor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successore novo vincitur omnis amor,</quote> <trans><tr>by a new favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 462</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novus habendus (clipeo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositi successor honoris Junius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 77</bibl></cit>: successor fuit hic tibi, Galle; <cit><quote lang="la">Propertius illi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he followed you</tr>, <tr>wrote after you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 53</bibl></cit>.—Of a female: Phoebe, Fraternis successor equis, Corn. Sev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 66</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
successorius: <entryFree id="n46260" type="main" key="successo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>successor</etym>, <sense id="n46260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successory</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in jurid. Lat.): de successorio edicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 9, 1</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex successorio capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 6, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorio jure aliquid tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
successus: <entryFree id="n46261" type="main" key="successus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46262" type="main" key="successus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succedo</etym>. <sense id="n46262.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to succedo, I.) <hi rend="ital">An advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46262.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus et incursus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 616</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-class.), a place which one goes down into, <hi rend="ital">a cavern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 251</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to succedo, II.) <hi rend="ital">A succession</hi> of time, <hi rend="ital">continuance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">continuo totius temporis successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex successu continuae felicitatis obliviscitur se hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a happy issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi> (the usual signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): successu exsultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnestheus successu acrior ipso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos successus alit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successum dea dira negat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 914</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo successu Fabiis audaciam crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentus fortuito successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 3: successumque artes non habuere meae, Ov. R. <pb n="1788" /> <cb n="SUCC" /> Am. 624: <cit><quote lang="la">successu rerum ferocior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 384</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 495 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus improborum plures allicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO">10, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec successum victoriae moderatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantusque rerum successu haberi coeptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:22" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successu rerum florentes opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:1" default="NO">21, 6, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleni successibus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus prosperos dare, Liv. prooem. § 13: ne successibus deesset auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.5" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt Graecorum commenta ... feminam ... suā manu suos exstinxisse successus, i. e. Medea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succi: <entryFree id="n46263" type="main" key="Succi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succidaneus: <entryFree id="n46264" type="main" key="succi_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. succedaneus, <sense id="n46264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succidia: <entryFree id="n46265" type="main" key="succi_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>. <sense id="n46265.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">side of meat cut off</hi>, esp. of pork; <hi rend="ital">a leg of pork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flitch of bacon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.L. 5, § 110</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hortum ipsi agricolae succidiam alteram appellant,</quote> <trans><tr>their second flitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46265.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a slaughtering</hi>: succidias humanas facere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succido: <entryFree id="n46266" type="main" key="succi^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>ĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-cado</etym>, <sense id="n46266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall under</hi> any thing. * </sense><sense id="n46266.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica quod e loris de corio crudo pectoralia faciebant: postea succidit Gallica e ferro sub id vocabulum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were comprehended under the word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 116</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n46266.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to sink under one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46266.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua inedia succidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fragore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis conatibus aegri Succidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecta sublabantur aut succidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo labore gravia genua succiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46266.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens succidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax Dardania domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 863" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 863</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46267" type="main" key="succi_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n46267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi> (rare but class.; not in Cic.): is pernas succidit iniquā superbiā Poeni, Enn. ap. Fest. pp. 304 and 305 Müll. (Ann. v. 279 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos Succisis feminibus poplitibusque invenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poplitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura equis (with suffodere ilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:11" default="NO">11, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 58 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem aratro, Verg.A.9,435: frumentis succisis,</quote> <trans><tr>cut down</tr>, <tr>mown down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herbas) curvamine falcis aënae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:536 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 536 al.</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita gregem metite imbellem ac succidite ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>mow down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens succisa manu Herculeā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 702" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 702</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">succisa libido,</quote> <trans><tr>emasculated</tr>, <tr>made powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 190</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succidus: <entryFree id="n46268" type="main" key="succi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucidus.</entryFree>
succiduus: <entryFree id="n46269" type="main" key="succi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sinking down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">failing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n46269.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 116</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46269.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedictio,</quote> <trans><tr>faltering</tr>, <tr>trembling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n46269.3" n="III" level="1"> = succidaneus (late Lat.), Ven. Misc. 4, 25, 10.</sense></entryFree>
succincte: <entryFree id="n46270" type="main" key="succincte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. succingo, <sense id="n46270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succinctim: <entryFree id="n46271" type="hapax" key="succinctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>succingo</etym>, <sense id="n46271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinctly</hi>: denotare, Claud. Mam. Stat. Anim. praef.</sense></entryFree>
succinctio: <entryFree id="n46272" type="main" key="succincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girding about</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Jul. 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
succinctorium: <entryFree id="n46273" type="main" key="succincto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apron</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. adv. Manich. 2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. adv. Manich. 2</bibl>. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Verb. Dom. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. Verb. Dom. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 14, 17 al.</sense></entryFree>
succinctulus: <entryFree id="n46274" type="hapax" key="succinctu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [succinctus], <hi rend="ital">girded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succinctus: <entryFree id="n46275" type="main" key="succinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. and P. a.</hi> of succingo.</sense></entryFree>
succinerarius: <entryFree id="n46276" type="main" key="succi^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭnĕrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-cinis</etym>, = succinericius, panis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Hos. 2, 8, 7 al.</bibl></entryFree>
succinericius: <entryFree id="n46277" type="main" key="succine^ri_cius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cinĕrīcius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared under the ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>baked under the ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUCC" /> 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 12, 39</bibl>; id. Osee, 7, 8 al.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succineus: <entryFree id="n46278" type="main" key="succi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucineus.</entryFree>
succingo: <entryFree id="n46279" type="main" key="succingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gird below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tuck up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girdle</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; cf. subligo). </sense><sense id="n46279.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crure tenus medio tunicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:455" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astricti succingant ilia ventres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 271</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginem et Leonem Anguis intortus succingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit> (7), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (Scylla) feris atram canibus succingitur alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 732</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 892</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eāpse sic succincta,</quote> <trans><tr>tucked up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 62: <cit><quote lang="la">cursor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 156</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem ritu succincta Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:536" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 536</bibl></cit>; 9, 89.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">succincta comas pinus,</quote> <trans><tr>with its bare trunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 603</bibl>: quis illaec est, quae lugubri Succincta est stolā, <hi rend="ital">girt about</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 198, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 134 Vahl.): succincti gladiis mediā regione cracentes, <hi rend="ital">girt about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, id. ap. Fest. s. v. cracentes, p. 53 (Ann. v. 497 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">gladio succinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallā succincta cruenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 555</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amictu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12,401</bibl></cit>: succincti corda machaeris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 678</bibl> (Ann. v. 392 ib.): pugione succinctus, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultro succinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46279.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit out</hi> with any thing (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepio, circumdo): quod multo se pluribus et majoribus canibus succinxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra se terrore succinxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his animum succinge bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam latrantibus inguina monstris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla rapax canibus succincta Molossis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineam canibus succincta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago succincta portubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctus armis legionibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximarum gentium viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius ferme Orientis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum scientiā debet esse succinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā papyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (very rare and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46279.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">proni atque succincti ad omnem clausulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46279.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Contracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinct</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis, circumscriptus): libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores succinctiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 17, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctior brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 157" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 157</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cinctē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinctly</hi> (late Lat.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter, strictim): docere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succingulum: <entryFree id="n46280" type="hapax" key="succingu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succingŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>succingo</etym>, <sense id="n46280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower girdle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
succino: <entryFree id="n46281" type="main" key="succi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">succăno</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 75</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cano</etym>, <sense id="n46281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n46281.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubicines imitatus est succinente Habinnā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantibus iste tuis alterno succinet ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:79" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46281.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agricultura) succinit pastorali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamat: Victum date. Succinit alter: Et mihi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>another chimes in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succinum: <entryFree id="n46282" type="main" key="succi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sucinum.</entryFree>
succinus: <entryFree id="n46283" type="main" key="succi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucinus.</entryFree>
succipio: <entryFree id="n46284" type="main" key="succi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. suscipio <sense id="n46284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succisio: <entryFree id="n46285" type="hapax" key="succi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidiana pilorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succisivus: <entryFree id="n46286" type="main" key="succi_si_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. subsecivus.</entryFree>
succisor: <entryFree id="n46287" type="main" key="succi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prunes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam (silvam) nec si serā succisor falce repurget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 4, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succisus: <entryFree id="n46288" type="main" key="succi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. succido.</entryFree>
succlamatio: <entryFree id="n46289" type="main" key="succla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succlamo</etym>, <sense id="n46289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shouting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acclamation</hi> after any thing (rare; perh. not anteAug.); only <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro territuri succlamationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succlamo: <entryFree id="n46290" type="main" key="succla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-clāmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim</hi> after or in reply to any thing (not in Cic. or Cæs.); with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Virginio vociferanti succlamabat multitudo, nec illius dolori nec suae libertati se defuturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUCC" /> quidam ausi sunt mediā ex contione succlamare: <cit><quote lang="la">Abite hinc, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si esset libera haec civitas, non tibi succlamassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centuria fre quens succlamasset, nihil se mutare sententiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: succlamatum est, et frequenter a militibus Ventidianis, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc cum succlamatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 53</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46290.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicā succlamatus invidiā,</quote> <trans><tr>cried out against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium maledictis succlamatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 19:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succlausus: <entryFree id="n46291" type="main" key="succlausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-claudo</etym>, <sense id="n46291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-closed</hi> [Appul.], Polem. Physiogn. p. 128.</sense></entryFree>
succlino: <entryFree id="n46292" type="main" key="succli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlīno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-clino</etym>, <sense id="n46292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline somewhat</hi>, Ven. Fort. Ep. Praem. Carm. 5, l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succo: <entryFree id="n46293" type="main" key="succo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. suco.</entryFree>
succoelestis: <entryFree id="n46294" type="main" key="succoelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-coelestis</orth>, v. succaelestis.</entryFree>
succoeno: <entryFree id="n46295" type="hapax" key="succoeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-coeno</orth>, v. succeno.</entryFree>
succoeruleus: <entryFree id="n46296" type="main" key="succoeru^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succoerŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. succaer-.</entryFree>
succollo: <entryFree id="n46297" type="main" key="succollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-collo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>collum</etym>, <sense id="n46297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take upon the neck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoulder</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">apes fessum (regem) sublevant, et si nequit volare, succollant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">attollunt umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 217</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">vicissim succollantibus (lecticam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succollatus et a praesente comitatu imperator consalutatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succonditor: <entryFree id="n46298" type="gloss" key="succondi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-condĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior officer in the Circensian games</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 5</bibl>, and 340, 3.</sense></entryFree>
succontumeliose: <entryFree id="n46299" type="hapax" key="succontu^me_li^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-contŭmēlĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n46299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat insolently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contumeliously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succoquo: <entryFree id="n46300" type="hapax" key="succo^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŏquo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cook a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia igni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succoriatio: <entryFree id="n46301" type="main" key="succo^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŏrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-corium</etym>; med. t. t., <sense id="n46301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an operating beneath the skin</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-Soran. Quaest. Medic. 245.</sense></entryFree>
succornicularius: <entryFree id="n46302" type="gloss" key="succorni^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cornĭcŭlārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sub-adjutant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second adjutant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3490</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succortex: <entryFree id="n46303" type="hapax" key="succortex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cortex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inner bark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succosus: <entryFree id="n46304" type="main" key="succo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucosus.</entryFree>
succrassulus: <entryFree id="n46305" type="hapax" key="succrassu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crassŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [crassus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thickish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis qualitate succrassulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succrepo: <entryFree id="n46306" type="main" key="succre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crĕpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crackle beneath</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Vit. Beat. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Vit. Beat. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succresco: <entryFree id="n46307" type="main" key="succresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n46307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from under</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ordine naturali pilorum (in palpebris) alius ordo succrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succrescit ab imo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne patiantur herbam succrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mores mali, Quasi herba irrigua, succrevere uberrime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46307.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> to any thing: toties haustum cratera repleri Sponte suā, per seque vident succrescere vina, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be supplied anew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 680</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46307.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: non enim ille mediocris orator vestrae quasi succrescit aetati, <hi rend="ital">grows up after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeds</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gloriae seniorum succrevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succretus: <entryFree id="n46308" type="main" key="succre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succerno.</entryFree>
succrispus: <entryFree id="n46309" type="main" key="succrispus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crispus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat curled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frizzled</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crisped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juba equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars inferior caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succrotillus: <entryFree id="n46310" type="main" key="succrotillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crotillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">succrotilla vox tenuis et alta. Titinnius: femina fabulare succrotillā voculā. Afranius in epistulā: loquebatur succrotillā voce serio. Plautus in describendis mulierum cruribus gracilibus in Syro: cum extortis talis, cum succrotillis crusculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
succrudus: <entryFree id="n46311" type="main" key="succru_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crūdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat raw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half raw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <trans><tr>parboiled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succrudum incidendum ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not fully ripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succruentus: <entryFree id="n46312" type="main" key="succru^entus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crŭentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bloody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livor facie contusā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succuba: <entryFree id="n46313" type="main" key="succu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭba</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>1. succubo</etym>. <sense id="n46313.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who lies under;</hi> hence, in mal. part., <hi rend="ital">a lecher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strumpet</hi> (post-class.): florulentus,<pb n="1789" /> <cb n="SUCC" />  Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 192; cf. 2. succubo.—</sense><sense id="n46313.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a supplanter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 250, 18.</sense></entryFree>
succubo: <entryFree id="n46314" type="main" key="succu^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie under</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">grabatulo succubans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 229, 30.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46315" type="main" key="succu^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n46315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lies under;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a lecher</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 22</bibl> (but Com. Fragm. v. 92 Rib. reads: quam arbitrer Illarum subcuboneam esse, i. e. succubam).</sense></entryFree>
succuboneus: <entryFree id="n46316" type="main" key="succu^bo_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭbōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2 succubo.</entryFree>
succulentus: <entryFree id="n46317" type="main" key="succu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. suculentus.</entryFree>
