succultro: <entryFree id="n46318" type="main" key="succultro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cultro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), no <sense id="n46318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>culter</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cut up with a knife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to chop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mince</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulpas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succumbo: <entryFree id="n46319" type="main" key="succumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cumbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>cŭbŭi, cŭbĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self under</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sink down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; not in Cic.; cf. subsido). </sense><sense id="n46319.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti succumbens victima ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 370</bibl></cit>: vidit Cyllenius omnes Succubuisse oculos, <hi rend="ital">had sunk in sleep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had closed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 714</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Augustus) Nolae succubuit,</quote> <trans><tr>took to his bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non succumbentibus causis operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 16</bibl> Hildebr.—</sense><sense id="n46319.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46319.4" n="1" level="3"> Of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to lie down</hi> to a man, <hi rend="ital">to cohabit</hi> with him (cf. substerno): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:111:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 111, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:810" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 810</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 502, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:201" default="NO">14, 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.5" n="2" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case>, of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to be a rival to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnae Tethyos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 177" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be overcome; to submit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succumb</hi> (the predom. and class. signif.; cf.: cedo, me summitto). </sense><sense id="n46319.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosopho succubuit orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Cannensi ruinae non succubuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogantiae divitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur succumbis cedisque fortunae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli neque homini neque perturbationi animi nec fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno animo et erecto est, nec umquam succumbet inimicis, ne fortunae quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori, Caes. B. G, 7, 86: oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:609" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 609</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 749</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse viri debilitari dolore, frangi, succumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (socero) subvenire volt succumbenti jam et oppresso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succubuit famae victa puella metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:810" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ille perculsus plagā non succubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succumbe, virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacta mens succubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 950" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 950</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 33</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n46319.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipsam perpeti succubuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succumbus: <entryFree id="n46320" type="main" key="succumbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succumbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boundary-stone</hi>, Auct. Limit. pp. 265 and 302 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
succuneatus: <entryFree id="n46321" type="hapax" key="succu^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭnĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [cuneo], <sense id="n46321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wedged underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supported with wedges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succurator: <entryFree id="n46322" type="main" key="succu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cūrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subcurator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succurro: <entryFree id="n46323" type="main" key="succurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-curro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>curri, cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46323.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46323.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: tempore eodem aliud nequeat succurrere lunae Corpus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 763</bibl>; cf.: pagus Succusanus, quod succurrit Carinis, <hi rend="ital">runs</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lies under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 48</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n46323.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten to the aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assistance of</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (the predom. and class, signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: subvenio, adjuvo, sublevo): ut laborantibus succurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti fortunisque communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succurrit illi Varenus et laboranti subvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictis semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis cedentibus auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: oppido, Auct. B. Afr. 5, 1.—</sense><sense id="n46323.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be useful for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 70</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of medicines: cannabis succurrit alvo jumentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>helps</tr>, <tr>relieves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 97, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strangulationibus (crethmos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenis fungorum (nitrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>: dum succurrere humanis erroribus <cb n="SUCI" /> cupiunt, ipsi se in errores maximos induxerunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se confidere munitionibus oppidi, si celeriter succurratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratae lites: succurrendum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46323.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46323.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">licet undique omnes in me terrores periculaque impendeant omnia, succurram atque subibo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will encounter and undergo them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46323.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to come into the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur to</hi> one (class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subit): ut quidque succurrit, libet scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: illud etiam mihi succurrebat, grave esse, etc., id. fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO">8, 3, 81</bibl> et saep.: succurrit versus ille Homericus, etc., Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non succurrit tibi, quamdiu circum Bactra haereas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cuiquam facile succurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud annotare succurrit, unum omnino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari succurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:171" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 51, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succursor: <entryFree id="n46324" type="gloss" key="succursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succursor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succurro</etym>, perh. <sense id="n46324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succorer</hi>, who comes to the aid of the bestiarius, in the combats with beasts in the circus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2530</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succurvus: <entryFree id="n46325" type="hapax" key="succurvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-curvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat curved</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succus: <entryFree id="n46326" type="main" key="succus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sucus.</entryFree>
succusanus: <entryFree id="n46327" type="main" key="Succusa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succusānus</orth> <itype>pagus</itype>, v. succurro <sense id="n46327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succussator: <entryFree id="n46328" type="hapax" key="succussa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succusso</etym>, <sense id="n46328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolter</hi>: caballus, <hi rend="ital">a jolting horse</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 30</bibl>; cf. succussor.</sense></entryFree>
succussatura: <entryFree id="n46329" type="hapax" key="succussa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jolting</hi> of a hard-going horse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succussio: <entryFree id="n46330" type="hapax" key="succussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succutio</etym>, <sense id="n46330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">succussio est, cum terra quatitur et sursum ac deorsum movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succusso: <entryFree id="n46331" type="hapax" key="succusso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succusso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jerk up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jolt</hi> (as a hard-going horse does his rider), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. 568 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
succussor: <entryFree id="n46332" type="hapax" key="succussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolter</hi>, said of a horse: sonipes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 31</bibl>; cf. succussator.</sense></entryFree>
succussura: <entryFree id="n46333" type="hapax" key="succussu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = succussatura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 24</bibl>.</entryFree>
succussus: <entryFree id="n46334" type="main" key="succussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46335" type="main" key="succussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succutio</etym>, <sense id="n46335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jolting</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl> (Trag. Rel. 257 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">membra tremulo succussu quatit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 29</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 49 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
succustos: <entryFree id="n46336" type="hapax" key="succustos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-custos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant-overseer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succutio: <entryFree id="n46337" type="main" key="succu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ussi, ussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-quatio</etym>, <sense id="n46337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fling up from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fling aloft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46337.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 333</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n46337.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultūs succussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit> ext. 5.</sense></entryFree>
sucerda: <entryFree id="n46338" type="main" key="sucerda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sucerda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sus and root skar-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skw/r;</foreign> cf. stercus</etym>, <sense id="n46338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dung of swine</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 175, 14</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 178 Rib.; cf. excerno, 2).</sense></entryFree>
suche: <entryFree id="n46339" type="main" key="Suche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucido: <entryFree id="n46340" type="main" key="su_ci^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fresh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sucidus: <entryFree id="n46341" type="main" key="su_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy; fresh</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289</bibl></cit>: tonsurae tempus inter aequinoctium vernum et solstitium, cum sudare inceperunt oves; <cit><quote lang="la">a quo sudore recens lana tonsa sucida appellata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">such wool was much used in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and was called sucidae sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl></cit>: (puella) <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucinacius: <entryFree id="n46342" type="main" key="su_ci^na_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucinum</etym>, <sense id="n46342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amber-colored</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucineus: <entryFree id="n46343" type="hapax" key="su_ci^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novaculae,</quote> <trans><tr>with amber handles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit> (al. sucinas).</sense></entryFree>
sucinum: <entryFree id="n46344" type="main" key="su_ci^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amber</hi>, usu. called electrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:65:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 65, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:11" default="NO">5, 37, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:573 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 573 al.</bibl> <cb n="SUCU" /></sense></entryFree>
sucinus: <entryFree id="n46345" type="main" key="su_ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucinum</etym>, <sense id="n46345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:59:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suco: <entryFree id="n46346" type="hapax" key="su_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucker;</hi> of a usurer, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>, b, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
sucophanta: <entryFree id="n46347" type="main" key="su_co^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcŏphanta</orth>, v. sycophanta.</entryFree>
sucositas: <entryFree id="n46348" type="hapax" key="su_co_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sucosus</etym>, <sense id="n46348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juici ness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:151" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucosus: <entryFree id="n46349" type="main" key="su_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of juice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succulent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 70, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana, i. e. sucida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 60, 1054</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber (stirpium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi> in money, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucro: <entryFree id="n46350" type="main" key="Sucro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n46350.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now the <hi rend="ital">Xucar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town at the mouth of this river</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sueca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 7</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucrō-nensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Sucro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:21" default="NO">2, 7, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near the coast of Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Rutulian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 505</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suctus: <entryFree id="n46351" type="main" key="suctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sugo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46352" type="main" key="suctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucking</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucula: <entryFree id="n46353" type="main" key="su^cu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>perh. root <foreign lang="greek">seu/w,</foreign> to drive</etym>, <sense id="n46353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of machine for drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lifting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a winch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windlass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capstan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a wine-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oil-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46354" type="hapax" key="su^cu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pig</hi>, only in paronom. with 1. sucula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46355" type="main" key="su^cu^la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">u(/w,</foreign> to rain</etym>, mostly <number>plur.</number> suculae, <sense id="n46355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation Hyades</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(a/des,</foreign> Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri a similitudine cognominis Graeci propter sues impositum arbitrantes imperitiā appellavere suculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 247</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:34" default="NO">2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:36" default="NO">2, 2, 36</bibl>; 2, 2, 89.</sense></entryFree>
suculentus: <entryFree id="n46356" type="main" key="su_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of juice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succulent</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n46356.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 631</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46356.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 57 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suculus: <entryFree id="n46357" type="hapax" key="su^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little boar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1:37" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucus: <entryFree id="n46358" type="main" key="su_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succus</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (collat. form, <sense id="n46358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> sucūs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 28</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sucuum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 32</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sap</hi> (class.; cf.: liquor, latex). </sense><sense id="n46358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46358.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes ex terrā sucum trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ex intestinis et alvo secretus a reliquo cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae suo sibi suco vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae suco saturi (equi solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 120</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:16" default="NO">4, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus nuci expressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 63, § 135</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus suci plenum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>plump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies suci palaestrici plena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of other liquids: <cit><quote lang="la">garo (mixtum) de sucis piscis Hiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora suco pinguis olivi Splendescunt,</quote> <trans><tr>oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aluntur bubuli lactis suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inbui lactis sucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio faciendi (unguenti) duplex, sucus et corpus: ille olei generibus fere constat, hoc odorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23</bibl></cit>, praef. 2, § <cit><quote lang="la">2: candidus ovi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1052</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46358.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a medicinal liquor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potion</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">purgantes pectora suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 403</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 581</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46358.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the taste</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum sentimus in ore, cibum cum Mandendo exprimimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:615 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 615 sq.</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">xumo/s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ova suci melioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Picenis cedunt pomis Tiburtia suco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celantia sucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantharus ingratus suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46358.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ac sanguis (civitatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: ingenii, Quint. prooem. § 24. — </sense><sense id="n46358.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> of <pb n="1790" /> <cb n="SUDO" /> a discourse, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatur oratio ... suco suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ille et sanguis incorruptus usque ad hanc aetatem oratorum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis subtilitas etsi non plurimi sanguinis est, habeat tamen sucum aliquem oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes etiam tum retinebant illum Pericli sucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia quoque alere orationem quodam uberi jucundoque suco potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudabundus: <entryFree id="n46359" type="hapax" key="su_da_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweating</hi>: turba, Auct. Carm. ad Pis. 176.</sense></entryFree>
sudariolum: <entryFree id="n46360" type="main" key="su_da_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sudarium</etym>, <sense id="n46360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little handkerchief</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 307, 37 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sudarium: <entryFree id="n46361" type="main" key="su_da_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sudor</etym>, <sense id="n46361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloth for wiping off perspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handkerchief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudario candido tergere frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO">11, 3, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 309, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatilis: <entryFree id="n46362" type="main" key="su_da_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing like sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatio: <entryFree id="n46363" type="main" key="su_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n46363.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —* </sense><sense id="n46363.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., <hi rend="ital">a sweatingroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concamerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sudator: <entryFree id="n46364" type="hapax" key="su_da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that perspires easily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatorium: <entryFree id="n46365" type="main" key="su_da_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. sudatorius, II.</entryFree>
sudatorius: <entryFree id="n46366" type="main" key="su_da_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serving for sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudatory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46366.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n46366.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sweatingbath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweating-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sudatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa balinea ac sudatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 51, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatrix: <entryFree id="n46367" type="hapax" key="su_da_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sudator</etym>, <sense id="n46367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that sweats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">causes sweating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudiculum: <entryFree id="n46368" type="hapax" key="su_di^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdĭcŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūdŭc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sudor, producing sweat</etym>, <sense id="n46368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of whip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sudines: <entryFree id="n46369" type="main" key="Sudi_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sudīnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writer on precious stones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 35, § 114 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sudis: <entryFree id="n46370" type="main" key="su^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭdis</orth> (<sense id="n46370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> only, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 54, § 154</bibl> infra), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> (syn.: palus, sublica). </sense><sense id="n46370.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes stipitesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 524</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 359</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 559</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quominus putrescerent sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24</bibl></cit> § 101 al. — In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:299 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 299 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 174</bibl>.—As a weapon: <cit><quote lang="la">multa vulnera sudibus facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 65</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes in terga erectae,</quote> <trans><tr>bristles</tr>, <tr>spines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densae,</quote> <trans><tr>thorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxeae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rocky peaks</tr>, <tr>crags</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46370.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pike</hi> (a fish); perh. Esox sphyraena, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 54, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudo: <entryFree id="n46371" type="main" key="su_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">i)d-; i)=dos, i(dro/s,</foreign> sweat; Germ. Schweisz]. </sense><sense id="n46371.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (class.), <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46371.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46371.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine causā sudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudavit et alsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum sudantibus lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cum Cumis Apollo sudavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum sudasse simulacra nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere et sudare vita cardiaci est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montes sudantes conscendimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perspire with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wet with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drenched in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fit ut in speluncis saxa superne Sudent umore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 943</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cavae tepido sudant umore lacunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudabant fauces sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta duo sanguine sudasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor signa sanguine multo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma sudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umore Cumanus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: terra sudat sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 33</bibl> (Trag. v. 213 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of the moisture itself, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi odorato referam sudantia ligno Balsama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis odoratis umor sudavit ab uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:191" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, qs. to sweat or perspire from exertion, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> <cb n="SUDO" /> <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fatigue one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tire one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self out</hi>, etc. (rare but class.; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. Neue Folge, 12, p. 458 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: contendo, luctor): sudabis satis, Si cum illo inceptas homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cassum defessi sanguine sudent, Augustum per iter luctantes ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides sudare me jamdudum laborantem, quomodo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudandum est his pro communibus commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mancipii redhibitione sudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has meus ad metas equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ingenti pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:443" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 443</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ferrea sudant Claustra remoliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 526</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parabile est, quod natura desiderat: ad supervacua sudatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46371.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">emit by sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exude</hi> (cf. destillo). </sense><sense id="n46371.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et durae quercus sudabunt roscida mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia electra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora Orientis, ubi tura et balsama sudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudata ligno Tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum baca Venafri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 101, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 93:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 93, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46371.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to sweat out</hi> a thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry on laboriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo labore Cyclopum Sudatum thoraca capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomere messes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zonam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deunces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:149" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:92" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:189" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 189</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46371.11" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n46371.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To saturate with sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat through</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vestes sudatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.13" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to sweat through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend in sweating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actae sub pellibus hiemes aestatesque inter bella sudatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 8" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudor: <entryFree id="n46372" type="main" key="su_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> [sudo). <sense id="n46372.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspiration</hi>: manat ex omni corpore sudor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 399 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 944</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor e corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: totum sudor habet corpus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 436 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem multum consecutum esse audiebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis simulacrum multo sudore manavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor fluit undique rivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsusque per artus Sudor iit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus toto manabat corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos Fumantis sudore quatit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sudor ad imos Manaret talos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat obsessos sudor mihi frigidus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudore fluentia multo Bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 923" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 923</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam in conspectu populi sudor erumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:122:6" default="NO">122, 6</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi> of verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem emittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 18, 18, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores evocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 48, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 46, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 60, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 217" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 25, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 79, § 260</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudoribus corpus exinanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores exsistere toto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>honey-dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46372.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. umor): maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smyrnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picis (with liquor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum quod exit a fornace sudorem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 19, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. sudo, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">sweat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigue</hi> (class.; syn.: labor, contentio): Salmacida spolia sine sudore et sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl> (Trag. v. 36 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">victor exercitus, qui suo sudore ac sanguine inde (a Capuā) Samnites depulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo ejus sudore ac labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus ille tuus multi sudoris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor circa testimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:6" default="NO">6, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo cum sudore consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:128:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 128, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalerae multo sudore receptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditur Sudoris minimum habere comoedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 169</bibl></cit>: non est viri timere sudorem,<cb n="SUES" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudore acquirere quod possis sanguine parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>: et bellicos sudores nostros barbaricae gentes cognoscunt, Just. Inst. prooem. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
sudorifer: <entryFree id="n46373" type="main" key="su_do_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype> <etym>sudor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n46373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sudorific</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:206" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudorus: <entryFree id="n46374" type="hapax" key="su_do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudor</etym>, <sense id="n46374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dripping with sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweaty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 354, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suduculum: <entryFree id="n46375" type="hapax" key="su_du^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdŭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sudes</etym>, <sense id="n46375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cf. sudiculum).</sense></entryFree>
sudus: <entryFree id="n46376" type="main" key="su_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>se-udus; cf.: sudum siccum quasi seudum id est sine udo, Fest. pp. 294 and 295 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n46376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry;</hi> and of the weather, <hi rend="ital">cloudless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (class.; cf. serenus). </sense><sense id="n46376.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: ventorum flamina suda, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 31, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 234:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 234, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor luminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta specula vel uda vel suda videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 283, 37</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudum,</quote> <trans><tr>brightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46376.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear weather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sudum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horologium mittam et libros, si erit sudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sudum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Per sudum rutilare vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46376.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhat moist</hi> = subudus; <cit><quote lang="la">ardentia viscera adhuc suda de sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sue: <entryFree id="n46377" type="main" key="Sue_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Assyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suebi: <entryFree id="n46378" type="main" key="Sue_bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbi</orth>, v. Suevi.</entryFree>
suebri: <entryFree id="n46379" type="main" key="Suebri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suebri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suel: <entryFree id="n46380" type="main" key="Suel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suël</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suelleni: <entryFree id="n46381" type="main" key="Suelle_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suellēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
