suelteri: <entryFree id="n46382" type="main" key="Suelteri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suelteri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sueo: <entryFree id="n46383" type="main" key="su^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> <etym>assumed as a stem for the form sŭēmus, which is probably a contracted <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, = suevimus from suesco; cf. consuesco and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)w/qamen</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n46383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare suemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere suemus (dissyl.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perhibere suemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 369</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suesco: <entryFree id="n46384" type="main" key="su^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭesco</orth>, <itype>sŭēvi, sŭētum</itype> (dissyl. suēvi, suētum; sync. forms, suesti, suerunt, suesse, etc.; <sense id="n46384.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. also the preced. art.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. svadhā, will, might, custom; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/qos, h)=qos</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n46384.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become used</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accustomed;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have accustomed one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n46384.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. press.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus in Illyricum missus est, ut suesceret militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46384.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. perff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has Graeci stellas Hyadas vocitare suërunt, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111: a te id, quod suesti, peto, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere suevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de divis dare dicta suërit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmis florere arbusta suësse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere suevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">sueverat claustra remoliri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 194</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46384.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accustom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi> (very rare in finite verb): <cit><quote lang="la">ut lectos viros ... disciplinae et imperiis suesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>. —Esp., <hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suētus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n46384.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituated;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliis sentire sueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala secundis rebus oriri sueta, Sall. Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 18: suetus abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru succedere sueti Quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexare suëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitialem propter morbum despui suetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 34, § 69</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (armis) ego suetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque conjugiis suscipiendis neque alendis liberis sueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suetae aquis volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sueti latrociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suetus civilibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 325</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46384.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">contra Cheruscis sueta aput paludes proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sueto militum contubernio gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 198, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 232, 13.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suē-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad sectae sueta conferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suessa: <entryFree id="n46385" type="main" key="Suessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/essa.</foreign> <sense id="n46385.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five miles south of the Liris and eight from the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded</hi> B. C. 337 <hi rend="ital">by the</hi> <pb n="1791" /> <cb n="SUFF" /> <hi rend="ital">Aurunci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards made their capital. It was often called Suessa Aurunca</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sessa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 8, 18</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">it was the birthplace of the satiric poet Lucilius</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 15, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46385.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Alba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered by Tarquinius Superbus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually called Suessa Pometia. It was destroyed by Spurius Cassius</hi>, B. C. 502, <hi rend="ital">and its site is unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16</bibl> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 400</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Suessa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suessan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Suessano,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Suessan territories</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Suessa</hi> (Aurunca), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 151, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">262, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suessetani: <entryFree id="n46386" type="main" key="Suesseta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessetāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessetānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suessiones: <entryFree id="n46387" type="main" key="Su^essi^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭessĭōnes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭessōnes</orth>, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 423</bibl>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Gaul</hi>, in the neighborhood of the modern <hi rend="ital">Soissons</hi>, Caes, B. G. 2, 3; 2, 12; 2, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suessula: <entryFree id="n46388" type="main" key="Suessu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castel di Sessola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 14</bibl>; 23, 17; 23, 32; 24, 46.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sues-sŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Suessula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2369</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetonius: <entryFree id="n46389" type="main" key="Sue_to_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suētōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n46389.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Suetonius Paulinus (Lenis), <hi rend="ital">father of the foll.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46389.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Suetonius Tranquillus, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and friend of the younger Pliny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the biographies of the first twelve Roman emperors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 11, 3</bibl>. See, concerning him, Bähr's Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 216 sq.</sense></entryFree>
suetri: <entryFree id="n46390" type="main" key="Suetri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suetri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetudo: <entryFree id="n46391" type="main" key="sue_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suesco</etym>, <sense id="n46391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">blanda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Pell. Euchar. 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">271</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetus: <entryFree id="n46392" type="main" key="sue_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suesco.</entryFree>
suevi: <entryFree id="n46393" type="main" key="Sue_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbi</orth> (in inscrr. always; but most MSS. have Suevi), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Suevi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a powerful people in the north-eastern part of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 51</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n46393.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-bus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Suevi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suevan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <trans><tr>worn in the manner of the Suevi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 134</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Suevi</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 655</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46393.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-vĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Suevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> and 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n46393.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-vĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Suevic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suevius: <entryFree id="n46394" type="main" key="Sue_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sufes: <entryFree id="n46395" type="foreign" key="su_fes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūfes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">suffes</orth>), <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Phoen. <foreign />, a judge</etym>, <sense id="n46395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief magistrate of the Carthaginians</hi>, corresponding to the Roman consul, <hi rend="ital">a sufet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3056 sq.</bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll., and Gesen. Script. Phoenic. Monum. p. 394.</sense></entryFree>
sufetula: <entryFree id="n46396" type="main" key="Sufetu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sufetŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Africa</hi>, Aug. c. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 6, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffarcino:
<entryFree id="n46397" type="main" key="suffarci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-farcĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stuff full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cram</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n46397.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedunt suffarcinati cum libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: vidi Cantharam Suffarcinatam, <hi rend="ital">stuffed out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with a bundle under her dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellule suffarcinatus,</quote> <trans><tr>crammed full</tr>, <tr>gorged with food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem multis muneribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 230, 26.—</sense><sense id="n46397.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro et argento et veste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense>
(* <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffarrānĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffarrānĭus</orth>, a false read. for furnariae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 135</bibl> Sillig ad h. l.)</entryFree>
suffectio: <entryFree id="n46398" type="main" key="suffecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sufficio</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n46398.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An adding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 251</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46398.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substituting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum alterna mortuorum atque viventium suffectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. suffectura.</sense></entryFree>
suffectura: <entryFree id="n46399" type="main" key="suffectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplement</hi> (post-class.): suffectura <cb n="SUFF" /> est quodammodo spiritus animae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
suffectus: <entryFree id="n46400" type="main" key="suffectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sufficio.</entryFree>
suffenates: <entryFree id="n46401" type="main" key="Suffe_na_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suffēnātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nebula Suffena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town in the Sabine territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffenus: <entryFree id="n46402" type="main" key="Suffe_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suffēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridiculed by Catullus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
sufferctus: <entryFree id="n46403" type="main" key="sufferctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufferctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. suffertus.</entryFree>
sufferentia: <entryFree id="n46404" type="main" key="suffe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĕrentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffero</etym>, <sense id="n46404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toleration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufferance</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffermentatus: <entryFree id="n46405" type="main" key="suffermenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fermentātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fermento], <sense id="n46405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat fermented</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffero: <entryFree id="n46406" type="main" key="suffe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>sustŭli, sublātum, sufferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46406.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subicio): corium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: tergum, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46406.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mater potest sufferre lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—T. t. in jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">litis aestimationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to tender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:21" default="NO">21, 2, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. sustineo): an axis eum (mundum) sustineat an ipse se potius vi propriā sufferat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiali morbo vexatus, ut stare, colligere semet ac sufferre vix posset,</quote> <trans><tr>hold himself upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi> an evil or grievance (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: patior, tolero): plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1304</bibl></cit>: poenas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 396, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam sui sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Apollodorus poenas sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii poenas sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multam si sufferre voluissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro alicujus peccatis supplicium sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; in Plautus (like dare poenas alicui) with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde illi actutum sufferet suos servos poenas Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis victi Poeni poenas sufferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem, solem, sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vites) valenter sufferunt ventos et imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi hoc pejus sit, haec sufferre et perpeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> in Cic. Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec claustra nec ipsi Custodes sufferre valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (iter) superest, sufferte pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 21 et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syre, vix suffero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">si magis me instabunt, ad praetorem sufferam (sc. me rapi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffertus: <entryFree id="n46407" type="main" key="suffertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffertus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sufferctus</orth>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub - farcio</etym>, <sense id="n46407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crammed full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subicit suffectus posteriorem, Lucil. l. l.: aliquid se sufferti tinniturum,</quote> <trans><tr>something full-sounding</tr>, <tr>sonorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffervefacio: <entryFree id="n46408" type="main" key="sufferve_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fervēfăcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), no <sense id="n46408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warm from below</hi> (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affirmant, lapillos, qui sufferveflant, rumpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 51, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti heminis quinque suffervefactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 17, 21, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semuncia amyli cum ovo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 67, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffervefio: <entryFree id="n46409" type="main" key="sufferve_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffervēfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, v. suffervefacio.</entryFree>
sufferveo: <entryFree id="n46410" type="hapax" key="sufferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fervĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seethe gently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffes: <entryFree id="n46411" type="main" key="suffes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, v. sufes.</entryFree>
suffibulum: <entryFree id="n46412" type="main" key="suffi_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffībŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-fibula</etym>, <sense id="n46412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white four-cornered veil</hi>, worn on the head by priests and priestesses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl> Müll.; cf. Fest. pp. 348 and 349 ib.</sense></entryFree>
sufficiens: <entryFree id="n46413" type="main" key="suffi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sufficio.</entryFree>
sufficienter: <entryFree id="n46414" type="main" key="suffi^ci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sufficio</etym>, <sense id="n46414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18</bibl> (29), 3 dub.</sense></entryFree>
sufficientia: <entryFree id="n46415" type="main" key="suffi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sufficiency</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 5</bibl>; 9, 8.</sense></entryFree>
sufficio: <entryFree id="n46416" type="main" key="suffi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>facio</etym>. <sense id="n46416.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46416.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46416.2" n="1" level="3"> Of a building, <hi rend="ital">to lay the foundation for</hi>: opus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 29</bibl> Zumpt. —</sense><sense id="n46416.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to put into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dip in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, lanam medicamentis, <hi rend="ital">to impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 386, 10</bibl>, and 521, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">(angues) ardentes oculos suffecti sanguine et igni,</quote> <trans><tr>suffused</tr>, <tr>colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis suffecta genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffecta leto lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:822" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 822</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes sole suffecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shone through</tr>, <tr>irradiated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="SUFF" /> </sense><sense id="n46416.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> = suppeditare, <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/xein</foreign> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(nebulae) sufficiunt nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibus aliam naturam sufficit ex se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aëra rarum Sufficiunt nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus Sufficit umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut illae (salices) pecori frondem aut pastoribus umbras Sufficiunt saepemque satis et pabula melli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Hispania) Italiae cunctarum rerum abundantiam sufficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux agmina sufficit unus turbanti terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius eos excursionibus sufficiendo adsuefacerat sibi fidere,</quote> <trans><tr>by permitting to take part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse pater Danais animos viresque secundas Sufficit,</quote> <trans><tr>gives courage and strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 618</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 803</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To occupy with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ in</hi>: Horatius eos (milites) excursionibus (<case>dat.</case>) sufficiendo proeliisque levibus experiundo assuefecerat sibi fidere, <hi rend="ital">by employing them in sallies</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46416.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> for another; and esp., <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elect in the place of</hi> any one (class.; esp. freq. of magistrates, e. g. of consuls; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subrogo): suffectus in Lucretii locum M. Horatius Pulvillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: in Appii locum suffectus, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul in sufficiendo collegā occupatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne consul sufficiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorem in demortui locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffectis in loca eorum novis regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae (apes) regem parvosque Quirites Sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu tribunos modo seu tribunis suffectos consules quoque habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia collegam suffici censori religio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus vitio creatis suffecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 47, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius patri suffectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Conon Alcibiadi suffectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperante heredem suffici se proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 12</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the phrase suffectus consul, <hi rend="ital">a consul elected after</hi> the regular time, <hi rend="ital">a vice-consul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando duo ordinarii consules ejus anni alter morbo, alter ferro periisset, suffectum consulem negabant recte comitia habere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 16</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus suffectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 14, 2, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to supply instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish as a substitute</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">atque aliam ex aliā generando suffice prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimo eosdem (dentes) decidere anno, aliosque suffici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor caeli partes in ternas dividunt et singulis ventos binos suffectos dant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sufficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avail for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet the need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. suppeto); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">si.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46416.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam nec scribae sufficere nec tabulae nomina illorum capere potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque (ferrum) diu Suffecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani quoad sufficere remiges potuerunt, satis pertinaciter secuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sufficiebant oppidani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec exempli gratiā sufficient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non videntur tempora suffectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro magistratibus, qui non sufficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīs non sufficientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficit dicere, E portu navigavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, quia sufficiat, non esse sacrilegium, sed quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffecerit haec retulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: nec jam vires sufficere cuiquam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vires concipit suffecturas oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec iis sufficiat imaginem virtutis effingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac mihi quidem sufficeret hoc genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum cupiditati cum obsistere non poterant, tamen sufficere aliquo modo poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 48, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons, hominum lacte et carne vescentium abunde sufficiebat alimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae manus suffecere desiderio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:19" default="NO">3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires quae sufficiant labori certaminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summis operibus suffecturi vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio vel scenis suffectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod opus cuicumque discendo sufficiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominis sufficit tantum soli, ut relevare caput possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sufficit umbo Ictibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 810</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: terra ingenito umore egens vix ad <pb n="1792" /> <cb n="SUFF" /> perennes suffecit amnes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopi aerario nec plebe ad tributum sufficiente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus vix ad solacium unius anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani ad omnia tuenda non sufficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo nos ad patiendum sufficiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 17, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod si vires non suffecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non suffecturum ducem unum et exercitum unum adversus quattuor populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec locus in tumulos nec sufficit arbor in ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ego sufficiam reus in nova crimina semper?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nos obniti contra nec tendere tantum Sufficimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim sufficit, ut exorari te sinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficit, ne ea, quae sunt vera, minuantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 33, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficere tibi debet, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficere his credis, si probi existimentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 88, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">sufficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adequate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas vix tantis matura rebus, sed abunde sufficiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unica et sufficientissima definitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffigo: <entryFree id="n46417" type="main" key="suffi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten beneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affix</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecce aedificat: columnam mento suffigit suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antennae suffixit lintea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureis clavis crepidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 14, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua suffixa tigillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes multo auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 497" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 497</bibl></cit>: cruci suffixus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cruci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patibulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patibulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in cruce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 99, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 82</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 66: aliquem in crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Galbae hastā suffixum,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck upon a spear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia in suggestu fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona postibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos stimulos dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 206" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffimen: <entryFree id="n46418" type="hapax" key="suffi_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suffio</etym>, <sense id="n46418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fumigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for suffimentum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:731 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 731 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
suffimento: <entryFree id="n46419" type="hapax" key="suffi_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffīmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>suffimentum</etym>, <sense id="n46419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fumigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum bovem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suffimentum: <entryFree id="n46420" type="main" key="suffi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suffio</etym>, <sense id="n46420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fumigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">odor, fragrantia): in iis sine illius suffimentis expiati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia suffimentum sit (laurus) caedis hostium et purgatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. pp. 348 and 349 Müll.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffio: <entryFree id="n46421" type="main" key="suffi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym> fio = <foreign lang="greek">qu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n46421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fumigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; but cf. suffimentum; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporo, fumigo): (testam) suffito sertā et schoeno et palmā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis odoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 84: <cit><quote lang="la">suffire et purgare domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se taetris odoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos jocinore decocto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urnā suffitā haurit aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:676" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem recentem haedorum pilo,</quote> <trans><tr>to burn for the purpose of fumigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 42, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffitum anisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 187</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus aethereis terras suffire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to warm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1098" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1098</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffiscus: <entryFree id="n46422" type="gloss" key="suffiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffiscus</orth> <itype>dicebatur folliculus testium arietinorum, quo utebantur pro marsupio, forsitan dictus a fisci similitudine</itype>, Fest. pp. 308 and 309 Müll.</entryFree>
suffitio: <entryFree id="n46423" type="main" key="suffi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffio</etym>, <sense id="n46423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fumigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfuming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffitionem doliorum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffitiones commendavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus prosecuti redeuntes ignem supergradiebantur aquā aspersi: quod purgationis genus vocabant suffitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 3</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. laureati, p. 117.</sense></entryFree>
suffitor: <entryFree id="n46424" type="hapax" key="suffi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fumigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum suffitorem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffitus: <entryFree id="n46425" type="main" key="suffi_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suffio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46426" type="main" key="suffi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>suffio</etym>. <sense id="n46426.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fumigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fumigation</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">suffitu necare cimices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 48, § 100</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 61, § 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46426.1" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">the smoke produced by fumigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 116</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUFF" /></sense></entryFree>
suffixus: <entryFree id="n46427" type="main" key="suffixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suffigo.</entryFree>
sufflabilis: <entryFree id="n46428" type="main" key="suffla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sufflo</etym>, <sense id="n46428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be breathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 906</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sufflamen: <entryFree id="n46429" type="main" key="suffla_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag-chain</hi>, to check the motion of a wheel. </sense><sense id="n46429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotam astringit multo sufflamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardat sufflamine currum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a clog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impediment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec res atteritur longo sufflamine litis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 180, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sufflamino: <entryFree id="n46430" type="main" key="suffla_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflāmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sufflamen</etym>, <sense id="n46430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold back by a clog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n46430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rotam Ixionis, Sen. Lud. Mort. Claud. (Apocol.) 14, 3.—* </sense><sense id="n46430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi> in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta illi erat velocitas orationis, ut vitium fieret. Itaque D. Augustus optime dixit, Aterius noster sufflaminandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Contr. 4</bibl></cit>, praef. § 7.</sense></entryFree>
sufflammo: <entryFree id="n46431" type="hapax" key="sufflammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-flammo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subfl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam invidiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sufflatio: <entryFree id="n46432" type="main" key="suffla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subfl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sufflo</etym>, <sense id="n46432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puffing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflation</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">bullantium aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedurum est sufflatione viventibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sufflatorium: <entryFree id="n46433" type="main" key="suffla_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bellows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 6, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sufflatus: <entryFree id="n46434" type="spur" key="suffla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subfl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, a false read. for si afflavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 25, 4</bibl>.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n46435" type="main" key="suffla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufflātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. sufflo.</entryFree>
sufflavus: <entryFree id="n46436" type="hapax" key="suffla_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-flāvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subfl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light blonde</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sufflo: <entryFree id="n46437" type="main" key="sufflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-flo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subflo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.). <sense id="n46437.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow forth from below; to blow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puff out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46437.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, tibicen, refer ad labeas tibias, Suffla celeriter tibi buccas, quasi proserpens bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae ubi sufflatae sunt ex cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflata cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46437.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To blow upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores decrepiti, quos si sufflasses, cecidissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:54:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 54, 16</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46437.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid se sufflavit uxori suae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>got enraged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46437.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puff</hi> at or upon any thing. </sense><sense id="n46437.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflavit buccis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubetae arrepentes foribus (alveorum) per eas sufflant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46437.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffla: sum candidus,</quote> <trans><tr>puff yourself up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-flātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n46437.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloated</hi>: sufflato corpore esse, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46437.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blown out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi> with anger or pride; of language, <hi rend="ital">inflated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bombastic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflatus ille huc veniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: neque auro aut genere aut multiplici scientiā Sufflatus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(figura) recte videbitur appellari, si sufflata nominabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sufflati atque tumidi (in dicendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
suffocabilis: <entryFree id="n46438" type="hapax" key="suffo_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffōcābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suffoco</etym>, <sense id="n46438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suffocating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffocatio: <entryFree id="n46439" type="main" key="suffo_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffōcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 54:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 54, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, mulierum,</quote> <trans><tr>suffocation of the womb</tr>, <tr>hysterical passion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:158" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 158</bibl>; v. suffoco, I.</sense></entryFree>
suffoco: <entryFree id="n46440" type="main" key="suffo_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fōco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faux</etym>, <sense id="n46440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi> by compressing the throat (rare but class.; syn.: strangulo, elido). </sense><sense id="n46440.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem crassior saliva suffocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in melle situm suffocari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be suffocated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox suffocatur saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffocatae (mulieres),</quote> <trans><tr>hysterical</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl></cit>; cf. suffocatio.—</sense><sense id="n46440.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriā suffocante vitem,</quote> <trans><tr>that chokes</tr>, <tr>kills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem et Italiam fame,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to starve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
